speaker.whotheyare: Sarah Kay is a writer, performer and educator from New York City.
speaker.whylisten: Sarah Kay has shared her poems in cornfields in Iowa, an orthodontist's office in Nepal, a ship on a fjord in Norway, a nightclub in Singapore, the Royal Danish Theatre in Denmark, Carnegie Hall in New York City, the Kennedy Center in Washington, DC, the back rooms of dive-bars, middle school gymnasiums and once on top of someone's dining room table. She is the 2022 New Arizona Fellow at New America and the author of four books of poetry: No Matter the Wreckage, B, The Type, and All Our Wild Wonder. And she is the founder and co-director of Project VOICE, an organization that uses poetry to entertain, educate and inspire students and teachers worldwide.
